intro: Cryptantha hendersonii, commonly known as Henderson's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to purple. The plant produces distinctive, elongated seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
